summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2014 FORD F-150. WHILE DRIVING 10 MPH APPROACHING A STOP SIGN WITH THE BRAKE PEDAL DEPRESSED, THE BRAKES FAILED AND THE LOW BRAKE FLUID SENSOR ILLUMINATED. THE CONTACT WAS UNABLE TO STOP THE VEHICLE AND COASTED THROUGH THE STOP SIGN. THE CONTACT DROVE THE VEHICLE AROUND IN A CIRCLE BACK TO A PARKING SPOT TO SLOW THE VEHICLE DOWN. THE BRAKE PEDAL TRAVELED TO THE FLOOR BOARD. THE CONTACT HAD TO APPLY THE EMERGENCY BRAKE AND PLACE THE VEHICLE INTO PARK IN ORDER TO STOP. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER AND THE DEALER WERE NOT CONTACTED OR MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 16V345000 (SERVICE BRAKES). THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 75,000.
